attributes.action: take note that many English are becoming very disenchanted with the British state and so we ask the Prime Minister to instruct his government to give in general much more respect and recognition to the English, and in particular to require the Commission for Equality and Human Rights to confirm the existence of an indigenous English community, (the English racial group) and thus empower this community with the rights, protection and benefits granted to all racial groups in law.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
In a multi-racial state like the UK, where much is made of the need to create social cohesion, it is of utmost importance to recognise the existence of the English and not redefine and exclude us in a way that makes us feel justifiably resentful.  

How are we supposed to feel when we see other communities given recognition and resources while the existence of the English as a racial group is at best ignored and at worst denied?

This is a sure way to make the English see the British state as an enemy.
